title: VEGOILS-Palm up for third session on overnight gains in rival oils
text:
VEGOILS-Palm up for third session on overnight gains in rival oils

SINGAPORE, Oct 17 (Reuters) - Malaysian palm oil rose for a third consecutive session on Thursday even as the ringgit gained, buoyed by continued strength in rival oils on the Dalian Commodities Exchange.

The benchmark palm oil contract for January delivery FCPOc3 on the Bursa Malaysia Derivatives Exchange rose 0.7% to 2,268 ringgit ($541.68) by midday.

Both Dalian's January palm oil contract DCPF0 and the January soyoil contract DBYF0 last rose 1.1%.

Elsewhere, U.S. soyoil futures on the Chicago Board of Trade BOc2 were up 0.2%.

Palm oil is affected by price movements in related oils as they compete for a share in the global vegetable oils market.

The rally in palm oil prices, however, was capped by a firmer ringgit and weaker oil prices, a Kuala Lumpur-based trader said.

The ringgit was last up 0.2% against the dollar, making palm more expensive for buyers using other currencies, while oil prices eased after industry data showed larger-than-expected build-up in stocks in the United States.

Palm oil may revisit its Aug. 26 high of 2,312 ringgit per tonne, as it has pierced above a resistance at 2,266 ringgit, said Reuters analyst Wang Tao. soy and prices at 0432 GMT
